headline: PPG Industries misses quarterly profit estimates as divestitures, soft demand weigh
summary: Global paint supplier PPG Industries missed Wall Street expectations for second-quarter profit on Tuesday, hurt by the impact of recent business divestitures and softer demand in key markets. Last year, PPG sold both its architectural coatings business in the United States and Canada to American Industrial Partners for about $550 million and its silica business to QEMETICA for $310 million. The divestitures and lackluster demand across key markets such as Europe weighed on PPG's quarterly net sales, which came in at $4.19 billion, compared with $4.24 billion a year earlier.

headline: PPG Industries: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results met Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was also for earnings of $2.22 per share. The paint and coatings maker posted revenue of $4.2 billion in the period, exceeding Street forecasts.

raw.headline: PPG Industries: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The results met Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was also for earnings of $2.22 per share. The paint and coatings maker posted revenue of $4.2 billion in the period, exceeding Street forecasts.
